channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: My Word for 2024: Strong
item.description: Before I begin, know that I fully recognize that it’s May. I selected my word of the year way back in December of 2023. After letting it marinade for a few days, I spent an hour looking for the perfect bracelet on Etsy that would display its letters each and every day. I also knew... Read More

item.title: Women Over 50 Say This Natural Treatment Brings Life Back To Dull, Thinning Hair
item.description: Right this way to soft, voluminous hair.

item.title: Does expired sunscreen still work?
item.description: It's that time of year when everyone's looking forward to some fun in the sun. Too much sun can be dangerous, though. Exposure to UV radiation from the sun damages your skin, and children are especially vulnerable because they tend to spend more time outdoors and can burn easily. Skin damage from the sun increases […] The post Does expired sunscreen still work? appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: The Sound of Freedom
item.description: For a million years (more like 15,) I’ve been listening to a radio show: The Taylor Strecker Show. It’s a daily show that originated on SiriusXM and through a series of events became an independently broadcasted show on Patreon. There’s something interesting that happens when you listen to a daily show. You get to know... Read More

item.title: Found: A Non-Greasy Body Oil That Makes Arms & Legs Glow
item.description: When I say I want a summer glow, I want that glow to extend head to toe. Here's a smooth, non-greasy body oil that helps me achieve it.

item.title: Be sun savvy, protect yourself from skin cancer
item.description: Ultraviolet rays from the sun can cause skin damage in as little as 15 minutes. Prolonged exposure and damage can lead to various forms of skin cancer, many of which, thankfully, are preventable. The sun isn't the only skin-damaging predator. Tanning beds and smoking also can have ill effects on the body's outer layer. What are […] The post Be sun savvy, protect yourself from skin cancer appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part Two]
item.description: To review part one of this adventure with Taylor Swift, click here. Click here to see all the Instagram highlight videos from Denver Night One. Mile High Stadium was pink and sparkly from head to toe. Never had I ever seen so many women in one place, nor so many generations piled into one venue. ... Read More

item.title: 3 Tips To Live A Stronger, Not Just Longer Life Starting Now
item.description: Let's live stronger AND longer.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part One]
item.description: Do you ever have one of those experiences where you want to remember exactly how you felt? That’s how I feel about my experience at the Taylor Swift concert this weekend. Correction: At the Eras Tour. Saying it was a concert does not feel like enough to justify the magnitude of the event. Let’s talk about the... Read More

item.description: Plus, the best tape to use

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Improvements in prostate surgery
item.description: There will be approximately 299,010 new cases of prostate cancer diagnosed in 2024, according to the American Cancer Society. Treatments vary, including chemotherapy, hormone therapy, ablative therapy, immunotherapy, targeted drug therapy, radiation and prostate robotic surgery. Dr. Matthew Tollefson, a urologist at Mayo Clinic, explains how advancement in robotic prostate surgery is making it easier […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Improvements in prostate surgery appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.

item.title: Jenny Craig Recipe Creation: Turkey Philly Baguette
item.description: Special thanks to Jenny Craig for their sponsorship of this post. In honor of the Super Bowl this year, I decided to make a Philly to enjoy. item.title: The Hidden Struggles of Women with ADHD (And Why Diagnosis is So Hard To Catch)
item.description: Perpetual procrastination and feeling overwhelmed could be undiagnosed ADHD.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Coping with cancer-related fatigue
item.description: People can experience cancer-related fatigue before, during and after treatments. This is different from the typical tiredness. At times, your arms and legs might feel heavy, making it hard to move. It may be challenging to even get out of bed in the morning. Cancer-related fatigue can take a toll mentally too. It can sometimes […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Coping with cancer-related fatigue appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .
